poem:
Silent Shadows

In the shadowed halls,  
where whispers conspire  
to smother democracy's flame,  
a silent march  
of hands unseen  
weaves webs of  
"freedom" clothed in chains—  
the earth quivers,  
hearts endure,  
a bloomed resistance,  
fragile,  
holds within  
the chaos,  
a quiet  
anthem  
of hope.
